p: Convalescent plasma treatment has emerged as a promising option for the control of severe COVID-19 in the absence of specific antivirals. It is a strategy of passive immunization based on utilizing the hyperimmune IgG antibodies produced by individuals after recovering from COVID-19 [ 150]. In several case series, clinical improvement and reduction in the viral load have been reported [ 151â€“ 155]. However, there were no matched controls in these studies. Thus, the ongoing clinical trials will probably provide a higher level of evidence and data about the efficacy and safety of convalescent plasma therapy in COVID-19. We should also be cautious considering the potential severe reactions associated with convalescent plasma use such as anaphylactic reactions or transfusion-related acute lung injury [ 150].
